original: Boethius, Johannes, fil. dr, fd. folkhögskolerektor, Nässjö, f. 12/4/78 i Västerås av kontr :prost Edvard B. o. Maria Segerström. G. 1. 08 m. Elna Hammer, d. 37; 2. 40 m. Karin Färg. Barn: Margit f. 13, g. m. lantbr. Tuve Jonsson, Risinge. — Stud:ex. i Västerås 97, fil. kand. i Upps. 03, fil. lic. 08, fil. dr 18. Lär. v. Lunnevads folk-högsk. 07-08, v. Ronneby dito 08-11, förest, f. Ronneby sem. 09-10, förest, f. folkhögsk. i Nässjö 11-43. Ordf. i Sv. foilkh :sk :ilär :fören. 3Ö-3’7, i Jönköp. 1. körförb. 28-46, hed:led. 46, i Bildn:-förb. f. Jönköp. 1. 32-43, dess hed :iled. 43, led. av fören. Nordens ’skoilnd 34-43, v. ordf. i dess Jönköp :avd. sed. 37, ordf. i dess Nässjö-avd. sed. 45, ordf. i Riksfören. f. svenskh. bev. i uti. Nässjö-avd. sed. 25, v. ordf. i Ronneby folksk:styr. 11, v. ordf. i styr. f. Jönköp. 1. småsk:sem. 27-32, insp. f. Nässjö föreläsn :fören. 13-37, led. av stadsfullm. i Nässjö 14-15, v. ordf. i skolråd 27-30, ordf. i Nässjö musiksäll-sk. 27-35, ordf. i styr. f. alkoholistanst. Hemmet Gunnarskog 17-33 m. m. Skr.: Sägner m. m. från Orsa (14), Orsamålet, ljudlära (18), Jönköp. 1, folkhögsk. under 50 år (26), red. av sockenbeskrivn. över Orsa sed. 43, pedagog, o. språkvet :skapl. upps. m. ni. Hobby: musik. RNO.
translated: Boethius, Johannes, Ph.D., former Adult Education School Principal, Nässjö, born on April 12, 1878 in Västerås, son of District Dean Edvard B. and Maria Segerström. Married 1st in 1908 to Elna Hammer who passed away in 1937, and 2nd in 1940 to Karin Färg. Children: Margit, born in 1913, who married Farmer Tuve Jonsson in Risinge. Academic qualifications: Graduated from high school in Västerås in 1897, Bachelor of Arts degree from Uppsala in 1903, Filosofie Licentiat degree in 1908, and Doctorate degree in 1918. Teaching at Lunnevad's Folk High School from 1907-1908, Ronneby's Folk High School from 1908-1911, Director of Ronneby Seminar from 1909-1910, and Director of Folk High School in Nässjö from 1911-1943. Chairman of Swedish Folk High School Teachers Association from 1930-1937, Jönköping's 1st Choir Association from 1928-1946, Honorary Member from 1946, Jönköping's Art Association 1932-1943, and its Honorary Member from 1943. Member of the Nordic School Council from 1934-1943, Vice Chairman of its Jönköping section since 1937, Chairman of its Nässjö section since 1945, Chairman of the National Association for Swedish Temperance Movement in Nässjö section since 1925, Vice Chairman of Ronneby Peoples School Board in 1911, Vice Chairman in the Board for Jönköping's Elementary School in 1927-1932. Inspector for Nässjö Lecture Association from 1913-1937, Member of the Nässjö City Council from 1914-1915, Vice Chairman of the School Board from 1927-1930, Chairman of Nässjö Music Society from 1927-1935, Chairman of Board for the alcohol institution "Hemmet Gunnarskog" from 1917-1933, and more. Author of "Legends from Orsa" (1914), "The Orsa Language, Phonetics" (1918), "Jönköping's Folk High School for 50 Years" (1926), "Editor of Village Description on Orsa since 1943", as well as papers on pedagogy and language studies. Hobby: Music. Awarded the Royal Order of the North Star.
